info.name: [AWD v2024-05-09] - AWD Inbound Order Creation
info.description:
## **What is the Amazon Warehousing & Distribution API?**

The Selling Partner API for Amazon Warehousing and Distribution (AWD) API lets you develop applications that create and update inbound Orders to ship inventory to AWD distribution centers and track shipments going into AWD distribution centers. For details about API operations and associated data types and schemas, refer to the [Amazon Warehousing and Distribution API reference](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/awd_2024-05-09-reference).

## **Key features**

- **Create Inbound orders:** Verify AWD inbound eligibility and execute API POST for order creation, specifying region preference.
    
- **Update inbound Order:** Update one or more individual attributes for an existing inbound order, such as updating the packagesToInbound, originAddress, and preferences attributes.
    
- **Cancel inbound Order:** Cancel an existing inbound order.
    
- **Retrieve Inbound Shipment Labels:** Retrieve box labels for confirmed inbound shipments.
    
- **Update Transport Details:** Update transport information for an AWD Inbound shipment.
    

**Tip**

- Use confirmInbound to confirm an inbound order and getInbound to retrieve the Inbound order details along with ShipmentId and status.
    
- Use checkInboundEligibility with packagesToInbound to obtain error details for Inbound Order creation
    

## **Terminology**

- **Inbound Order:** Inbound orders instruct the movement of inventory from an arbitrary location to an AWD distribution center. An inbound order has one or more inbound shipments. Each inbound shipment represents a trackable movement provided by an underlying transportation carrier.
    

## Fork Collection & Auth

1. To fork this collection, Click on "Run in Postman" Button or right-click the collection and click on Create a fork.
    
2. Fork the environment you need
    
3. Fill the environment variables. Make sure valid "client_id", "client_secret" and "refresh_token" are set.
    
4. Ensure environment variables {{variable}} are used as needed for your API calls parameters.
    

## **Use Case: AWD Inbound order creation workflow**

The following describes the steps to ship inventory to AWD distribution center. This is an illustrative example and does not include all of the optional operations.

## Prerequisites

To complete this tutorial, you need:

- Authorization from the selling partner for whom you are making calls. For more information, refer to [Authorizing Selling Partner API Applications](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/authorizing-selling-partner-api-applications).
    
- The [Amazon Warehousing and Distribution role](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/amazon-warehousing-distribution-role) assigned to your developer profile.
    
- The Amazon Warehousing and Distribution role selected in the app registration page for your application.
    

**Steps:**

Step 0: [Authorization to get Access token](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-d1c067d7-c901-4fb4-a87c-b96970df8e36?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.1 [Check Inbound Eligibility(Optional)](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-4a1829aa-c444-4631-88b0-7c626e7f96b2?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.2 [List Preperation Details(Optional)](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-08a3359e-8750-4f40-b53e-58868ee3774b?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.3 [Create Inbound Order](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-a319164b-e1e3-47fc-924b-8461a9a2ad28?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.4 [Get Inbound Order](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-4ddf9580-daa6-423a-be69-2b43b1cf925a?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.5 [Update Inbound Order(Optional)](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-d4fd6b89-96e9-4d4a-87e0-e72f3e95c05f?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.6 [Confirm Inbound Order](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-33680c62-b4fc-4448-8b28-21e33d3f75fc?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.7 [Cancel Inbound Order(Optional)](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-cdbb05e1-7d2f-48d6-8f18-f0551ee6c20c?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.8 [Retreive Inbound Shipment Box labels](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-bffae34a-507e-4ad5-b8d1-537dc1f1ef9c?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

Step 1.9 [Update Inbound Shipment Transportation details](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-a7c514ff-41d2-4c90-bd8e-f6c8a575445e?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)

item.name: Step 0: Authorization to get Access Token

request.description: Generate Access token to call other AWD API operations. The token is valid for 60 minutes.

item.description: Call this API to get the **access token** in exchange to the refresh token for authorizing SP API. A post-script is available and will store the returned access token to the environment variable access_token to then authenticate and authorize API requests.

item.name: Step 1: Initiate/Create AWD Inbound Order

request.description: Determine if the specified inventory is eligible for AWD inbound Order.

query.description: Only MSKUs in your account can be checked

request.description: Get preparation details for a list of MSKUs in a specified marketplace.

Creates a draft AWD inbound order with given packages to inbound. Currently only a single shipment will be created per order.  
By calling the createInbound operation, a seller must specify the following:

• The address from which the inbound shipments will be sent  
• A summary of the packages containing items that they intend to inbound.

The packagesToInbound must contain List of packages to be inbounded. ProductQuantity must include MSKU, quantity, and an indication of who will prepare / label the item.

Make sure each item you're shipping conforms to Amazon's product packaging requirements. For more information, refer to Packaging and Prep Requirements in Seller Central Help. For more information about Amazon's product packaging requirements for your marketplace, refer to Seller Central URLs. Note that sellers can specify the Prep Category for SKUs when creating an Inbound order. Limit Inbound Order to 150 unique SKUs per order creation.
Review Inbound order details and destination address by calling the getInbound operation

Updates the draft AWD inbound order with given packages to inbound. By calling the updateInbound operation, a seller can update the following:  
• packagesToInbound - List of packages to be inbounded.  
• originAddress - Origin address from where the inbound order will be shipped.  
• preferences attributes - Preferences such as Preferred region that can be passed in context of an inbound order.

The confirmInbound operation is an essential step in the AWD inbound process. It enables sellers to finalize their draft inbound orders, transitioning them from a DRAFT state to CONFIRMED status. This confirmation is required for all transportation types and indicates that the order details are now locked and ready for further processing. Once an order reaches CONFIRMED status, it advances in the Inbound workflow, allowing for subsequent steps in the inbound shipping process to begin.
Cancels an AWD Inbound order and its associated shipments.

item.name: Step 2: Manage Shipping

query.description: Page type for the generated labels. The default is PLAIN_PAPER.
The format type of the output file that contains your labels.

request.description: Call the getInboundShipmentLabels operation to request unique box labels for your inbound shipments. Each box label returned by the getInboundShipmentLabels operation should be affixed to the package in the shipment that it corresponds to, so the labels indicate the package contents. This helps to ensure that your shipment is processed at the AWD Distribution center quickly and accurately

Sellers must update tracking information after sending shipments to AWD distribution centers using non-partnered carriers. The updateInboundShipmentTransportDetails operation requires inputting the shipment ID and transportation information. For small parcel shipments, sellers provide an array of associated booking IDs, allowing Amazon to track and manage incoming inventory.

item.description:
Manage inbound shipment details by retrieving box labels and updating transportation information

2.1 [Get Inbound Shipment Box labels](https://awd-solutions-architect.postman.co/workspace/1d3321bf-a67c-4afb-9bb7-519a170e7791/request/16681627-bffae34a-507e-4ad5-b8d1-537dc1f1ef9c?action=share&source=copy-link&creator=16681627&ctx=documentation)
